did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, pamphlets, notes, reports, and military documents.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence and pamphlets concerning Barton's appointment as professor of military science at Cornell, alumni activities, the Boy Scouts, the R.O.T.C. program, Delta Upsilon Fraternity, and Cornell University's Semi-Centennial Celebration. Included are photographs of Barton, his family, and R.O.T.C. students, and Barton's Senior Ball medal (1891). Also, documents related to Barton's military service in the Philippines (1901-1902).

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Frank Barton was an army officer and professor of military science at Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and pamphlets concerning Barton's appointment at Cornell, alumni activities, the Boy Scouts, the R.O.T.C. program, Delta Upsilon Fraternity, and Cornell University's Semi-Centennial Celebration. Included are photographs of Barton, his family, and R.O.T.C. students, and Barton's Senior Ball medal (1891). Also, three ms. reports by Barton as a 1st Lieutenant in the Philippines, Jan. 22 and April 24, 1900, about patrol actions, and, as a captain, a research paper at the Army Staff College, 1912; letter from Andrew Dickson White, 1907; four letters from Barton's father, 1896; U. S. Army documents relating to issues of supplies and rations to Barton's company in the Philippines, 1901-1902; and notes on lectures at the military college.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Frank Arthur Barton papers, #33-2-448. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Papers - includes invitation and program for Theodore Roosevelt's inauguration
Manuscript reports, letters, notes, army documents relating to issue of supplies and rations
